Dear Ms Roberts
I am responding to your Freedom of Information request (as below) on behalf of Sheffield City Council, Children Young People and Families. Please accept our apologies for the delay in replying to you.
Question
Please could you identify the numbers of section 38(6) applications that have been made for residential family assessments over the last two financial years. From 1st April 2011 - 31st March 2012 and 1st April 2012 - to date
Response
Notice under Section 17(1) of the Freedom of Information Act 2000 - REFUSAL TO DISCLOSE INFORMATION
Decision:
After carefully considering your request for information to identify the numbers of section 38(6) applications made for residential family assessments, the Council has decided that to respond to your request would exceed the appropriate limit as defined in the Freedom of Information Act 2000
Basis for decision
Section 32 of the Freedom of Information Act provides for an absolute exemption for information which a public authority holds solely because it was contained in documents served upon the authority for the purposes of proceedings in a particular cause or matter.
Why does the exemption apply in this case?
We do not keep a separate log of the types of applications made in family court proceedings and the information would only be contained in legal documents
2 residential family assessment beds were purchased during this timeframe as follows:
Period: 1st April 2011 - 31st March 2012 - 2 beds commissioned with Twenty Four Seven
Period: 1st April 2012 - to date (none)
If you are unhappy with the service you have received in relation to your request and wish to make a complaint or request a review of our decision, you should write to Corporate Complaints Department, Sheffield City Council, Town Hall, Pinstone Street, Sheffield, S1 2HH, or e-mail: [
email address
], or complete our on-line form:
http://www.sheffield.gov.uk/your-city-co...
If you are not content with the outcome of your complaint, you may apply directly to the Information Commissioner for a decision. Generally, the ICO cannot make a decision unless you have exhausted the complaints procedure provided by Sheffield City Council. The Information Commissioner can be contacted at: The Information Commissioner's Office, Wycliffe House, Water Lane, Wilmslow, Cheshire SK9 5AF.
Kind Regards
Deborah Sockett
